Class DefaultTagAssistContributor

java.lang.Object
  com.rohanclan.cfml.editors.contentassist.CFEContentAssist
      com.rohanclan.cfml.editors.contentassist.DefaultTagAssistContributor
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAssistAttrValueContributor, IAssistContributor, IAssistTagContributor, org.eclipse.jface.text.contentassist.IContentAssistProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
CFMLTagAssist, HTMLTagAssistContributor
public class DefaultTagAssistContributor
extends CFEContentAssist
implements IAssistContributor, IAssistTagContributor, IAssistAttrValueContributor

The default tag assstor The tag Assistor can be used to provide generic tag-based assist. Do not use the CFMLTagAssist for that purpose because it only provides insight if the user types "

Author:
Oliver Tupman

getTagProposals

public org.eclipse.jface.text.contentassist.ICompletionProposal[] getTagProposals(IAssistState state)
Description copied from interface: IAssistContributor
Determines whether the assist wishes to contribute to the current proposals. Not sure whether this is really needed as getProposals() would need to provide the same information as to whether it would trigger so getProposals() could just return a 0 length array or null.

Specified by:

Parameters:

Returns:
An array of completion proposals

isCorrectPartition

public static boolean isCorrectPartition(IAssistState state,
                                         java.lang.String partitionType)

Checks to see whether the partition supplied is of the correct type or not. Just a quick helper function.

NB: It also checks against the default partition type '__dftl_partition_content_type' for issue #199 "Content assist fails when there is a non-enclosing tag.". - Ollie

Parameters:
state - The current state of the content assist
partitionType - The type of partition to test against.
Returns:
